Comment: Recessed Meeting of June 6, 2017 HELD on June 15, 2017

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) announced the prescence of a quorum to the Acting President Pro Tempore (Deputy Leader Gentile).

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Council
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the display of wild or exotic animals for public entertainment or amusement.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the results of inspections of food service establishments operated in schools
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Approved by Council
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DHMH to report on the results of inspections of food service establishments operated in or by schools.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5484-A, and Assembly Member DenDekker, A.7185-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the general municipal law, in relation to pension benefits of widows or widowers of sanitation workers”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Pension benefits of widows or widowers of sanitation workers”. (S.5484-A / A.7185-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6626, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8323, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year two thousand eighteen”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the FY'18”. (S.6626 / A.8323)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5706, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7603, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing awards to spouses of emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians who are killed while engaged in the discharge of duty”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Providing awards to spouses of emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians who are killed while engaged in the discharge of duty”. (S.5706 / A.7603)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million people or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and  the  general municipal  law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New  York, in relation to making technical corrections thereto”.  (S.6046-B/A.7798-B)
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York (S.6046-B and A.7798-B)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million people or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and  the  general municipal  law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New  York, in relation to making technical corrections thereto”.  (S.6046-B/A.7798-B)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York (S.6046-B and A.7798-B)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million people or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and  the  general municipal  law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New  York, in relation to making technical corrections thereto”.  (S.6046-B/A.7798-B)
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York (S.6046-B and A.7798-B)

Items.MinutesNote: The Acting President Pro Tempore (Deputy Leader Gentile) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Acting President Pro Tempore (Deputy Leader Gentile) recessed the Meeting subject to call.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) was not present at this Recessed Meeting of June 6, 2017 held on June 15, 2017.  

The Deputy Leader (Council Member Gentile) assumed the chair as the Acting President Pro Tempore and presiding officer for this Recessed Meeting held on June 15, 2017.
The Bluebacks for Home Rule items SLR Nos. 5 to 10 of 2017 and M-520 of 2017 were adopted by the Council and sent to Albany.

Items.Title: The Public Advocate will call the meeting to order
Items.MinutesNote: The Acting President Pro Tempore Council Member Gentile (Deputy Leader) present and presiding
